content:
Thank you. How did you create the copy of the profile to move to new computer? Please be as specific as possible. For example, did you do it while Thunderbird was running? If so, that may have caused the profile copy to be corrupted and omit folders from the copy. If this is a windows computer, would you be able to restart the old computer and copy the profile again? Here are the basic steps for a successful transfer from one windows pc to another:

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

If doing that is not possible, can you create a screenshot of the profile folder that you copied to place on new computer? That would be very useful. If you are unsure how to do a screenshot to upload, let me know.
creator: davidsk

content: Click to 'account settings' and select an account as the default. When done, a star icon will appear to right of account name. This is a known bug.
